Author: Harper Lee
Description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

Book: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (Harry Potter, #1)
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: Harry Potter thinks he is an ordinary boy - until he is rescued by an owl and taken to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Author: Jane Austen
Description: Since its immediate success in 1813, Pride and Prejudice has remained one of the most popular novels in the English language.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the future.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A classic novel of teenage angst and rebellion.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: An epic high fantasy novel about the quest to destroy the One Ring.

Author: Markus Zusak
Description: A story set in Nazi Germany about a young girl's relationship with books.

Author: Charlotte Brontë
Description: An orphan girl's struggle for independence and love.

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Description: A powerful story of friendship and redemption set in Afghanistan.

Author: Lois Lowry
Description: A dystopian novel about a society without pain or choice.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Description: A poetic tale about loneliness, friendship, love, and loss.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A satiric fable about a group of farm animals who overthrow their human owner.

Book: The Diary of a Young Girl
Author: Anne Frank
Description: The wartime diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl in hiding during WWII.

Author: William Golding
Description: A novel about a group of boys stranded on an island who try to govern themselves.

Author: William Shakespeare
Description: A tragic play about two young star-crossed lovers.
